Package pool.poolView

Class Pool

java.lang.Object
processing.core.PApplet
pool.poolView.Pool
All Implemented Interfaces:
IpoolView, processing.core.PConstants
public class Pool extends processing.core.PApplet implements IpoolView
This class is a processing view.

    • newServer

      public static Pool newServer(String ip, int port, Pool p) throws IOException
      This method tries to start a new Server in the ClientServerThread
      Parameters:
      ip - the ip address of the host
      port - the port the server should run on
      p - an instance of the poolView
      Returns:
      the poolView
      Throws:
      IOException - if it can not start a server

    • newClient

      public static Pool newClient(String ip, int port, Pool p) throws IOException
      This method tries to start a new Client in the ClientServerThread.
      Parameters:
      ip - the ip address
      port - the port
      p - an instance of the poolView
      Returns:
      the poolView
      Throws:
      IOException - if it can not start a client, it automatically tries to be a server

    • draw

      public void draw()
      This method sends the location of the mouse and if it is pressed or not to the poolController. It also calls the nextFrame method in the poolController. And it handles the Server Client Communication.
      Overrides:
      draw in class processing.core.PApplet

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed()
      This method is called if a key is pressed. If it is the space key a method in the poolController is called.
      Overrides:
      keyPressed in class processing.core.PApplet

    • keyReleased

      public void keyReleased()
      This method is called if a key is released. If it is the space key a method in the poolController is called.
      Overrides:
      keyReleased in class processing.core.PApplet
